testSafeClaim().details: Uses EIP-191 formatted message that includes chainId, contract address, and user address

testSafeRejectsRawSig().details: This proves that EIP-191 formatting is enforced in Safe

testSafeReplayFails().details: Confirms that contract context prevents signature reuse across deployments

testVulnerableAcceptsRawSig().details: Shows that raw signatures are accepted, which would fail in Safe

testVulnerableClaim().details: Verifies that a valid ECDSA signature allows claiming

testVulnerableReplay().details: Demonstrates replay attack by reusing the same signature on a fresh deployment

message().notice: Raw message hash used for signing in vulnerable contract

setUp().notice: Deploys test contracts and prepares an example signed message for the vulnerable contract

testSafeClaim().notice: Tests that the Safe contract accepts a correctly signed, prefixed message with context

testSafeRejectsRawSig().notice: Tests that the Safe contract rejects raw (non-prefixed) signatures

testSafeReplayFails().notice: Tests that the Safe contract rejects replayed signatures from other contract instances

testVulnerableAcceptsRawSig().notice: Tests that the vulnerable contract accepts signatures without EIP-191 prefixing

testVulnerableClaim().notice: Tests a successful claim on the vulnerable contract with a valid signature

testVulnerableReplay().notice: Tests that a signature can be reused on another instance of the vulnerable contract

user().notice: Test user address, derived from private key 0x1

v().notice: Signature components used for vulnerable contract (shared)
